metadata.title: CVE-2016-10906 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/net/ethernet/arc/emac_main.c in theLinux kernel before 4.5. A use-after-free is caused by a race conditionbetween the functions arc_emac_tx and arc_emac_tx_clean.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10906` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-166-generic - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-lowlatency - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-166-generic - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-166-lowlatency - 4.4.0-166.195
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1060-kvm - 4.4.0-1060.67
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1096-aws - 4.4.0-1096.107
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1124-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1124.133
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1128-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1128.136
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-166.195').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1060.67').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1096.107').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1124.133').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1128.136').
